signatures.name: processMessage
signatures.description: Manually run a message through the command chain. This method gets called automatically by the [[ClientAdapter]].

children.description: Manually run a message through the command chain. This method gets called automatically by the [[ClientAdapter]].

signatures.name: start
signatures.description: Asynchronously starts the bot

modules.description: Starting point for your Gears app. Contains the [[ServiceManager]] and the root [[CommandGroup]]
modules.example: const bot = new Bot({ adapter, commands: [sum, multiply] })

modules.name: BotEvents

children.name: init
children.description:
The [[Bot]] has initialized but not started.
Use this to add bot specific configurations via [[Service]]

children.name: response
children.description: A response was returned from the called [[Middleware]]

modules.description: Events fired by a [[Bot]] instance

modules.name: BotOptions
modules.description: Options passed to the [[Bot]] constructor.

modules.name: ClientAdapter
modules.description: Adapts a messaging interface so a [[Bot]] can understand it

modules.description: Events fired by a [[ClientAdapter]]

modules.name: AdapterHooks
modules.description: Methods for interacting with a [[ClientAdapter]] in register()

modules.name: AdapterResult
modules.description: The resulting interface after registering a [[ClientAdapter]]

modules.name: Command
modules.description: An executable command which only executes if its [[Matcher]] is satisfied

modules.name: CommandOptions
modules.description: Options passed to the [[Command]] constructor

modules.name: CommandBuilder

signatures.name: done
signatures.description: Returns the built [[Command]]

signatures.name: match
signatures.description: Set [[Matcher]]

signatures.name: use
signatures.description: Add [[Middleware]]. The order that you call this is the order the middleware will be in

modules.description:
A way to build a [[Command]] with the builder pattern.
If you are using TypeScript, this is more typesafe to use

modules.name: CommandGroup
modules.description: A group of [[Command]], which will only match if the [[Matcher]] and a command in the group matches

modules.name: CommandGroupOptions
modules.description: Options passed to the [[CommandGroup]] constructor

signatures.name: match

signatures.description: Set the commands for this [[CommandGroup]]

signatures.name: use
signatures.description: Add [[Middleware]]. The order that you call this is the order the middleware will be in

modules.description:
A way to build a [[CommandGroup]] with the builder pattern.
If you are using TypeScript, this is more typesafe to use

signatures.description:
Match when the message starts with any of the provided keywords.
Removes the matching keyword from the [[Context]] content

Match when the message starts with any of the provided keywords.
Removes the matching keyword from the [[Context]] content

signatures.description: Matches at random

modules.name: RegExpResolvable
modules.description: Can be RegExp or () => RegExp

modules.name: matchRegex

signatures.name: matchRegex
signatures.description: Match when the provided regular expression matches, adds match array to [[Context]] state.

modules.description: Match when the provided regular expression matches, adds match array to [[Context]] state.

modules.name: ChainEntry
modules.description: A [[CommandLike]] and the [[Context]] at the point it was matched in a [[Chain]]

modules.name: CommandLike
modules.description: Represents either a [[CommandGroup]] or a [[Command]]

modules.name: Chain
modules.description: A chain of [[ChainEntry]] generated from a tree of [[CommandLike]] during message processing

modules.name: BaseContext
modules.description: Context before passed to the tree

modules.name: Context
modules.description: An object passed to [[Middleware]] and [[Matcher]]. Contains [[Bot]], [[ServiceManager]], the message and its content, and the state.

modules.name: Matcher
modules.description:
Determines if a [[CommandLike]] should run or not.
When it is called, it is passed the [[Context]] which is then returned if the matcher is satisfied

modules.name: Middleware
modules.description:
Middleware runs sequentially down the tree.
It allows you to attach state or perform actions within a [[CommandLike]]

modules.name: NextFunction
modules.description: The next [[Middleware]]

modules.name: Emitter
modules.description: A typesafe EventEmitter

modules.name: ArrayResolvable
modules.description: Can be T or T[]

modules.name: PromiseResolvable
modules.description: Can be T or Promise<T>

modules.name: Service

children.name: constructor

signatures.name: new Service
signatures.warning: Do not manually instantiate a service. Services are automatically instantiated by the [[ServiceManager]]

children.warning: Do not manually instantiate a service. Services are automatically instantiated by the [[ServiceManager]]

signatures.name: serviceDidInitialize
signatures.description: Hook called when the service has initialized, but the bot is ready

signatures.name: serviceDidRestart
signatures.description: Hook called when the service has started after stopping

signatures.name: serviceDidStart
signatures.description: Hook called when the service has started and the bot is ready

signatures.name: serviceDidStop
signatures.description: Hook called when the service has stopped and the bot is offline

modules.description: Stateful business logic living outside of [[Middleware]]

modules.name: ServiceOptions
modules.description: Options passed to the [[Service]] constructor
